meanings.definition: A type of heavy woolen cloth.
meanings.sent1: I bought a warm witney blanket for the winter.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used witney to make a sturdy coat.
meanings.sent3: The witney fabric was so thick, it could be used as a makeshift pillow.
meanings.sent4: Her witney scarf was like a cozy hug around her neck.
meanings.sent5: The witney material felt like a soft cloud against my skin.

meanings.sent1: My friend visited Witney last summer and loved the quaint streets.
meanings.sent2: Witney is known for its beautiful architecture and friendly locals.
meanings.sent3: In Witney, even the pigeons seem to have a British accent!
meanings.sent4: The charm of Witney is like a hidden gem waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: When I think of Witney, I imagine a picturesque village straight out of a storybook.
